item.title: Great Games Where Your Decisions Truly Matter
item.description:
Summary

  • Choices in video games can matter, with decisions altering storylines and character relationships significantly.
  • Popular RPG games like Fable 2 and Mass Effect 2 emphasize strategic choices impacting outcomes.
  • Content-heavy games like Detroit: Become Human and Life is Strange 2 are home to diverse narrative paths.

One of the factors that separates gaming from other popular forms of entertainment like film is that gaming, generally speaking, puts players in the shoes of the main character. Today, many games expand upon the idea of the player truly being in control of the protagonist by giving them a vast range of choices and decisions to make that will alter the direction of the story. This certainly isn't a new feature of gaming, as it was the key selling point of numerous 80s and 90s graphic adventures.

However, it's fair to say that the choices in many games today are far more expansive than ever before, and the popularity of games where the player's choices matter has led to significantly more games being available to choose from. Unfortunately, the popularity of decision-based games has meant that many developers and publishers have tried to shoehorn decision-making into their games despite the choices having little to no impact on the direction of the story. Thankfully, there are numerous games where decision-making isn't just a gimmick but a key, in-depth feature.

Updated February 22, 2025, by Mara Cowley: Choice-based games remain a popular option among gamers, especially those who are fans of RPGs or point-and-click adventures. These games allow players to feel as though they have true player agency within the game and its world, directly interacting with it, and influencing the coutcome. While there are many games where players' decisions don't have too much sway, there are plenty of decision-based games that provide players with ways to change how the story unfolds. This article already included some of the best choice-based games out there, but there are still many more that deserve to be hailed as such.

40 Saw

Tapp's Final Test is a Choice

Even those who aren't fans of horror know the movie series called Saw , and its killer Jigsaw, who places victims in deadly traps that require sacrifice to escape from. As with any popular movie, Saw received a video game adaptation, and one that was pretty good at the time.

Players control Tapp after the events of the first movie, as the detective is saved and kidnapped, and placed in an asylum where Tapp will face a cornucopia of different and grisly trials, saving other victims on his way. At the game's end, players are given a choice that will greatly affect the ending they receive: escape the traps with the others, or pursue the killer, both with drastically different outcomes.

39 King's Quest 5

One Key Decision Can Make the Game Unwinnable

The game developers at Sierra are responsible for many great point-and-click adventure games, such as Gabriel Knight and King's Quest . The fifth entry into the latter series introduces players to protagonist Graham after his castle is engulfed by a magically conjured whirlwind before it vanishes. Only King Graham is the one left behind, as he was outside the castle when it occurred. He sets off on a quest to find the wizard responsible and return the castle and all his family.

While exploring the world, players might encounter a cat hunting a mouse. Unless the player has the foresight to intervene, the game becomes unwinnable. This is an excellent example of the players' actions — or lack thereof — having the most impact on the game, as it may see the game end prematurely.

38 Batman: The Enemy Within

The Player has a Direct Impact on The Joker's Character

Telltale Games prides themselves on choice-driven games. They confront players with decisions they must make quickly, as well as providing dialogue choices to allow them to address other characters as they wish. Batman: The Enemy Within is one such game, letting players control the Caped Crusader as he does what Batman does best: protecting the people of Gotham.

Many famous villains make their appearance in this game, but the dark stars of this show are Joker and Harley. Their relationship is inverted so that Harley is the manipulative mastermind, and Joker is the one manipulated. But the player can also have a hand in shaping the Joker's character. Depending on how they choose to treat him, the player either makes him become a vigilante, or turns him into a villain.

37 Dragon Age: The Veilguard

Minor Choices Echo Throughout The Game

In the role of Rook, it is up to the player to stop the Gods from enacting their plans to spread the Blight over the world, which would end all life as it is known. On their quest to do so, they will travel to many different locations, meet many different people, and, of course, be met with different choices, such as decided the fate NPCs, and how they speak to them.

Decisions made, such as the fate of the Mayor in D'Meta's Crossing, will have consequences that players won't know about until they are further in the game. Smaller choices, such as which dialogue options they pick, will even have influences on future dialogue with that same character. The result is a game where players truly feel that their choices are being taken into account.

36 Chrono Trigger

Choices Made Throughout Various Eras Will Influence the Narrative

Even back in the mid 90s, developers such as Square Enix allowed players to have a hand in how their game plays out by presenting choices that could have a major impact on the story. This is no more true than with one of their most beloved RPGs of all time, Chrono Trigger .

The game's story will take players and their companions through several different eras on their quest to save the world as they know it. And with time travel stories, there are always consequences for meddling with the timeline. Choices that the player makes can change how the narrative unfolds , which is an impressive amount of freedom considering the game's age.

35 Fable 2

The Final Decision Determines The Player Character's Fate

Fable 2 was perhaps the most heralded title in the series, and it is clear to see why. It oozed charisma, character, and took players on a whirlwind story in order to save the lands from the evil powers of Lucien, the man who killed their older sister when they were both poor orphans living on the streets.

Players will be presented with choices throughout Fable 2 , and the well-implemented morality system gives their decisions weight and can alter how their character looks. There are three possible endings to Sparrow's adventure, and what choice the player makes will determine what ending they receive. It certainly isn't an easy choice to make, and most players will go through multiple playthroughs just so they can experience everything Fable 2 has to offer.

34 I Was A Teenage Exocolonist

The Character's Life Hinges On Certain Decisions That Can Be Made

In a game that perhaps rings a bit too true to reality, the Earth has become unlivable, leading to a group of colonists taking a spaceship through a wormhole to colonize a habitable planet. The player character falls into a coma and awakens to see their new home on Vertumna 4.

I Was A Teenage Exocolonist players have great agency with their character; they are able to customize them, select their childhood friend, and pick traits that can have an impact on their game. As the plot spans multiple years of the protagonist's life, the player chooses what activities they partake in as time passes, and some of these activities can even spell death for their colonists. The choices in this game are not to be underestimated, as they can have some of the biggest impacts seen in choice-based games.

33 Vampyr

The Fate Of London And Its Inhabitants Rest In The Bloody Hands Of Dr. Reid

Army medic Jonathan Reid returns to his home in London after his time in the war, only to be welcomed back into the arms of death. He awakens in a mound of corpses and must learn to temper his thirst as he upholds the hippocratic oath even in death.

However, it is up to the players if they want to resist the hunger for blood. There are many humans that players are free to feed on to grow more powerful, but this choice will have consequences. If enough humans are drained, the district becomes dangerous, and Jonathan Reid loses just a little of himself, which is reflected in the ending. Alternatively, Vampyr players can ignore the beast inside and choose to remain an ally and protector of the people.

32 Frostpunk

Players Choices During Construction Can Impact The Lives Of Inhabitants

One might think that a city builder game such as Frostpunk couldn't qualify as a choice-based game, but they would be wrong. Along with the gameplay of creating cities, constructions, and advancing technology to protect habitations and inhabitants from the bitter cold, smart choices and resource-managing all play a big part in this game and require smart thinking on the player's side.

Players will also be challenged to certain moral choices throughout the game that can have serious consequences for their settlements. Making the wrong choice could cost several lives, but what makes these choices even more impactful is the fact none of them are easy. Players might even be forced to make a few suffer for the betterment of many.

31 Road 96

Players Decisions Alter The Entire Story And The Setting

Road 96 takes players on a tour through the fictional nation known as Petria, an authoritarian place nearing a new election that could shake the political landscape. A group of hitchhiking teenagers are attempting to escape across the border without being caught by border patrol. Each failure results in the player taking control of one of the other teens, with the decisions made during their subsequent run referenced in this new one.

There are more decisions to be made outside a player's escape attempts, such as interacting with various NPCs and engaging in mini-games to learn more about them and the world at large. One's choices in Road 96 have the potential to shape the future of an entire nation.

30 The Quarry

Decisions Must Be Made Quickly, And They Have The Potential To Lead To Death

The Quarry is a strong entry in Supermassive's library of horror games, taking clear inspiration from classic horror titles such as Friday the 13th with its summer camp setting and roster of counselors who are more interested in throwing parties than following the rules.

Before long, they learn that their extra night at camp has led to disastrous consequences, as werewolves prowl these woods and will tear apart any person they come face to face with. Players will not only be challenged with QTEs but also with decisions that must be made quickly. These decisions can lead to the deaths of characters, which makes the timer placed on the player even more stressful.

29 Tyranny

Player Choices Can Lead To The Eradication Of Locations

Set in a fantasy world with its own unique technology, Tyranny puts the player in the shoes of the Fatebinder, tasked with the onerous mission to quell the rebellion rising due to the infighting of two major factions or die along with everyone else.

With stakes this high, it makes sense there are many sensitive choices the player must make that can have drastic consequences. Depending on what choices players follow, some game locations may not even exist, dramatically altering the narrative path.

28 Disco Elysium

The Player's Build Can Alter What Information They Are Privy To

Disco Elysium is an ambitious RPG that impressed gamers with its unique dialogue system and well-crafted characters. The game features very little combat, focusing more on plot, dialogue, and player agency.

Like most RPGs, players are able to put points into skills to create a unique build for their character, and even this choice is one to be made with care. Depending one's builds and background, the player may be privy to unique tidbits of information and lore they wouldn't know otherwise, which they can then use to their advantage during some conversations with certain NPCs.

27 Oxenfree

Dialogue Choices Play A Big Role In The Player's Relationship With Characters

This charming graphic 2.5D adventure game sees players controlling Alex, a teenager who unwittingly frees a dangerous paranormal power that they must now find and put a stop to.

As they are trying to save the island, players can stop and chat with the various other characters in a unique way, as they are still free to move around during conversations. Oxenfree players will be offered multiple dialogue choices, with each one having the possibility to affect the relationship with the character in a positive or negative way. If the player cares for particular characters, they need to be mindful of how they talk to them.

26 Divinity: Original Sin 2

Side Quests Can Be Failed, Causing NPCs To Never Return Or Die

Before Baldur's Gate 3, there was Divinity: Original Sin 2 , Larian's unique RPG set in original lore with pages of lore for players to sink their teeth into. Players could choose to play as one of the Origin characters or create their own Sourcerer to set upon the world and stop the Voidwoken.

Aside from the main quest, there are various side quests players can embark on, with choices that can result in the quest failing, causing the associated character to leave or even die. Players are given agency to approach missions how they wish, which they might encounter the consequences of later down the line.

25 The Outer Worlds

The Player's Morality Reflected Through Dialogue Options Directly Influence The Game's Ending

Following on from the major success of New Vegas , gamers were clamoring for another RPG game in the same vein as Obsidian, and they delivered with The Outer Worlds . This game changed the course of history by having Roosevelt never succeed McKinley, and megacorporations soon took over the earth, which had moved their ambitions to space, colonizing planets. They successfully do so, transforming many planets in the Halcyon system into new homes for citizens of Earth.

There are many choices players will be confronted with while space-faring in The Outer Worlds , both big and small, with some influencing the attitudes of other characters towards the player. These choices should not be made lightly, as players may come to regret it later.

24 As Dusk Falls

The Player's Actions At Pivotal Moments Can Change The Trajectory Of The Plot

This narrative-driven adventure drama game spins the tale of two families who find themselves crossing paths with one another in the Arizona desert after a robbery goes horribly wrong. In a similar vein to games more like Life is Strange and less like Dragon Age , it requires plenty of choice-oriented input from the players.

Split across two 'books,' As Dusk Falls plays like an interactive movie, with the players interjecting their choices into pivotal moments in the game and directly influencing the trajectory of the plot. It even has a co-op mode for players to have a friend join them, much like the Dark Pictures anthology series.

23 Assassin's Creed Odyssey

How Players Choose To Navigate Certain Missions Impacts The Ending

The Assassin's Creed franchise has taken players far and wide, from Renaissance Italy to Victorian London. Odyssey takes them back to the times of Ancient Greece, in which they take control of either Alexios or Kassandra as they fight as a Spartan in a war between Athens and Sparta. In comparison to earlier titles, Odyssey takes on more RPG elements, focusing less on stealth and more on combat.

It also features multiple endings, with the outcome depending directly on the player's choice. With a total of nine endings that players can get, they must make sure to make wise choices on certain missions if they want the best outcome.

22 Catherine: Full Body

The Game Poses A Moral Question Each Night, With Every Answer Influencing The Ending

Catherine: Full Body falls into the same category as P4 Golden or P5 Royal : It's not quite a remaster; it's more of a rework with added content. The new content found in Catherine mostly centers around newcomer Rin, who becomes the new neighbor of Vincent and one of the new possible romance routes that players can pursue. Suffering a bout of amnesia other than a certain piano melody Rin often plays, it is up to the players to help Rin uncover those buried memories.

Choices play a major part in this game, with the players given a question after every nightmare stage they pass. They will be confronted by a moral dilemma and given two answers to choose from. While some questions are obvious as to which will put them on the good or bad path, these become less obvious as the game progresses, and depending on how that morality meter looks like at the end of the game, Vincent's fate can be affected.

21 Baldur's Gate 3

Every Decision Proposed To Players During Missions Will Ripple Throughout The Entire Campaign

Larian's epic Dungeons and Dragons -themed RPG has captured the hearts of millions of gamers, bringing them and their characters into the world of Faerun as they travel far and wide in search of one with the skills to cure them of their recently acquired passenger. The quest to rid themselves of the Illithid passengers will bring them to multiple locations and multiple people, giving them the freedom to choose who they trust and ally themselves with.

These choices aren't ones to be made on a whim, as their ripples will be felt throughout the campaign. Siding with the wrong (or right) person can close players off from certain missions and companions.

item.title: 10 Best Action RPGs for Players Who Love Customization
item.description:
Summary

  • RPGs like Black Desert Online offer extensive character customization for unique playstyles.
  • Path of Exile 2 showcases advanced build customization for unique character experiences.
  • Games like Skyrim provide revolutionary build mechanics for engaging RPG experiences.

Whether as a warrior, archer, mage, or cleric, playing video games is often closely with experiencing different lives in a completely new world. Since the early days, the ability for players to customize their own character has been a feature that stands out as something particularly unique to the medium of gaming.

This characteristic is especially important for RPGs, or Role-Playing Games, whose very name describes the experience as the act of embodying another life or role. In this context, some titles stand out for their extensive customization options, ranging from altering the character's appearance to changing gameplay by selecting new abilities to face challenges in a completely new way.

Black Desert Online

Players Can Create Unique Characters With Freedom

Black Desert Online is an action RPG and open-world MMO that drew a lot of attention upon its announcement, specifically for its impressive character customization. The variety of facial features that can be adjusted and the vast number of unique characters players can create drew thousands to try the Korean game.

Additionally, as a great MMORPG, the game offers various builds and classes that can be tailored to different gameplay styles, changing how it’s played, allowing players to experiment with different options as they venture through it.

Path Of Exile 2

One Of Best Games For Build Customization

At its launch, Path of Exile 2 went viral through videos of players reacting for the first time to the game's build creation system. Even the most experienced players were taken by surprise, as the new title from Grinding Gear Games offers advanced customization, allowing each character to be truly unique with an incredible variety of skills and playstyles.

Inspired by classics like Diablo , this action RPG lacks an appearance customization mechanic but, at the same time, stands out as one of the games with the most extensive build variety in the genre. It’s a must-play for players who want the freedom to create different characters, customizing abilities or even the weapons obtained through enemy loot.

Dragon Age: Inquisition

It's Possible To Customize Different Builds In This Action RPG

Aiming to balance between the mechanics of the first two games in the franchise, Dragon Age: Inquisition introduced a distinct combat system, blending some of the tactical depth from Origins while maintaining the action-oriented approach of Dragon Age 2 . To make this experience even more distinct, the game provided players with a wide variety of classes and abilities to use throughout their journey.

However, another standout aspect of Dragon Age: Inquisition at launch was the advancements in appearance customization brought by the Frostbite 3 engine, which, at the time, impressed by allowing players to modify intricate facial details for each character. This made it possible to create truly unique Inquisitors as they ventured through Thedas.

Fallout 4

Players Can Build Aggressive Or Diplomatic Characters

Fallout 4 is one of the standout titles in one of the most famous RPG franchises of all time. The game is set in a post-apocalyptic future where players must survive in a world ravaged by nuclear war, filled with chaos and hostility. Like other great RPGs, it offers a deeply immersive experience, allowing players to create their own character and customize it how they want to.

So, their main character can focus on a more aggressive gameplay style, solving problems through violence, or take on a more diplomatic approach, relying on wit and charisma to achieve their goals. Additionally, the game also offers a great customization options, allowing players to craft their own weapons or even experiment with different builds through its unique perk system.

Diablo 4

Each Class Offers A Different and Customizable Playstyle In This Action RPG

One of the major appeals of the Diablo franchise is the variety of playstyles and characters players can create, and Diablo 4 is no exception. Blizzard's character creator allows players to design necromancers, druids, barbarians, mages, warriors, and more.

Set in a world overrun by demonic forces, players can face their enemies in various ways, switching between different classes and playstyles, each with unique weapons and visuals. In fact, each available character feels truly distinct, thanks to the variety of abilities they possess, allowing for builds that shape each experience.

Elden Ring

Endless Builds For Ultimate Versatility

Elden Ring is renowned for its exceptional gameplay, challenging difficulty, and a world created in collaboration between Hidetaka Miyazaki and writer George R.R. Martin. However, one of the key features in any FromSoftware game, also strongly present here, is character customization.

The character creator, while still not one of Elden Ring 's strongest aspects, allows for better-looking faces compared to the developer's previous soulslike titles. However, the real highlight of the game lies in its versatility in gameplay customization. Weapons, skills, armor, and magic provide countless combinations of powers, allowing players to overcome enemies in a variety of ways.

Monster Hunter World

Weapons Define Entire Gameplay Experience

Monster Hunter: World is a especially unique game, because character customization mainly focuses on the weapon the player chooses to wield. Switching weapons in Monster Hunter is almost equivalent to playing a game with entirely different mechanics, each offering unique strategies and approaches for dealing with various creatures.

Additionally, at more advanced levels, players gain access to a wide range of options through buffs that can be incorporated into their builds, allowing for high-level customization tailored to enhance their hunting experience. Mastering these combinations is essential, as some endgame challenges can be quite punishing for players who are not adequately prepared.

Cyberpunk 2077

Modify Characters Physically And Mechanically

Since its release, Cyberpunk 2077 has been a significant promise for fans of tabletop role-playing games. Inspired by Mike Pondsmith's classic in the dystopian sci-fi genre, the game preserves some of its key features, emphasizing extensive character customization in both aesthetics and mechanics.

Set in a world teeming with implants and body modifications, this Action RPG provides extensive character customization. Players can modify appearance, build, and even the cybernetic implants of each version of V, allowing the gameplay experience to change entirely based on individual playstyle preferences.

Dragon’s Dogma 2

Customization That Exceeds Expectations

Dragon’s Dogma 2 follows in the footsteps of its predecessor by offering players a unique Action RPG experience with a level of freedom uncommon in other games of the genre. The game features an impressive Character Creator that allows players to design unique faces for their protagonist or even recreate the appearance of popular characters from other games.

However, Dragon’s Dogma 2 stands out not only for its detailed character appearance customization but also for the hundreds of build possibilities through skill and vocations combinations, as each option provides a distinct gameplay experience. This allows players to experiment with different choices to tackle bosses and other enemies throughout the game.

Skyrim

Revolutionary Builds Mechanics Keep Players Engaged In this Action RPG

Skyrim is widely regarded as one of the greatest RPGs ever made, largely due to the immense freedom it offers - something that was impressive at launch and remains so to this day. Another key reason behind this acclaim is the level of customization players have when creating or developing a character throughout their adventure.

Bethesda’s developers brought years of RPG experience to craft a game where each player can create a truly unique character. Skills are unlocked through use, allowing for versatile builds that combine traits from various classes, enabling players to shape their journey in their own way.

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games With No Or Limited Map Markers
item.description:
Summary

  • Elden Ring emphasizes natural exploration sans map markers, setting a benchmark for seamless open-world exploration.
  • Sunless Skies offers organic exploration and storytelling in a vast, improved sandbox setting.
  • Kenshi drops players in a dangerous wasteland with no objectives, requiring self-discovery and survival skills.

Some of the best open-world games players can get their hands on understand how frustrating it is to get lost while exploring a massive sandbox. However, map markers and waypoints are a clumsy solution that can take away from the magic of exploration that these games try to sell.

This is why open-world games need to figure out the best way to make exploration feel both organic and seamless. The best titles in this genre have nailed this balance finding ways to include no—or at least limited—map markers, and they are worth checking out for fans of quality open-world games.

8 Elden Ring

FromSoftware's World Design Makes Exploration More Organic

The beauty of Elden Ring stems from how natural its exploration feels. This game took a page out of Breath of the Wild's playbook, blending its open-world design with FromSoftware's action RPG expertise to make for a tantalizing combination.

It's made clear where players need to go without using map markers, which is a major achievement. The fact that an update that added a few minor map markers for NPC locations elicited such a polarizing response from players shows just how seamless exploration is in Elden Ring .

7 Sunless Skies

An Immersive Game With A Focus On Exploration And Storytelling

Sunless Skies is a massive improvement over its predecessor, shifting the setting from the seas to the skies and turning combat into a tense real-time affair. The slow exploration of the first game was addressed, with players enjoying a decent speed from the get-go while traveling from one area to another.

What makes Sunless Skies such a brilliant title stems from its organic exploration and excellent storytelling. Players will head to a place to make the most of some profitable trade deals, only to be immersed in the story of a settlement as the mysterious horrors of this title rear their ugly heads.

6 Kenshi

Drops Players Into The World With No Objectives

Unlike most other open-world games, Kenshi has no objectives to speak of. All players need to do is pick a background, following which they're unceremoniously dumped into a wasteland full of dangers that can tear them apart in no time.

Players must figure out how to amass a fortune, improve their skills, gather a party of explorers, and uncover all the content this game has to offer. As one would suspect, there are no map markers to speak of, and players must rely on their gut to make a decision that they'll explore after leaving the safety of a settlement.

5 The Matchless Kungfu

Players Make Progress On Their Own And Decide How The Open World Expands

  • Platform: PC
  • Release Date: November 6, 2024
  • Developer: HuanMos Game

A unique indie game with a ton of potential, The Matchless Kungfu is essentially a wuxia version of Kenshi with turn-based melee combat and an excellent progression system. From the moment players start their playthrough, the informational overload will make their heads spin.

Eventually, they'll grasp the basics and make enough progress to set more blocks that help increase the size of the open world. This makes for a unique gameplay loop where anything and everything can happen. As one would expect, players can't rely on map markers to guide them on any step of their journey.

4 Outer Wilds

Exploring The Galaxy Is Driven By Player Curiosity

The freeform design and unique knowledge-based exploration of Outer Wilds make it one of the best indie open-world games players can get their hands on. Players need to pay attention to the information they acquire on every step of their journey, since these tidbits contain valuable hints that help players make meaningful progress, and there are no other indicators to guide them to the next step.

It's a simple and tantalizing way to guide players in the right direction without overloading the game world with map markers. Outer Wilds can take a while to grow on players, but those who get invested in its mystery will find it hard to tear themselves away when there are so many leads to pursue.

3 Gothic

The Nameless Stranger Starts From Nothing And Must Struggle To Make A Name For Themself

Piranha Bytes is one of the most unique open-world RPG developers around, integrating tough combat systems and open-ended gameplay in their titles as players are unceremoniously dropped into unfamiliar worlds. Gothic is a great example of the same.

The landscape is fraught with horrors that can take out the Nameless Hero in a single hit. Players must figure out on their own that their experience can be cashed in to learn new combat moves, giving them the means to survive in a brutal, glorified prison where anything and everything is out to kill them.

2 The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind

An Old-School Open-World RPG Where Players Must Follow Directions And Read The Map

An old-school open-world RPG that fans will love, there's something about Morrowind that makes it deeply tantalizing even after all the time that's passed since it launched. Modern gaming trends have made later Elder Scrolls games easier to get into, but Morrowind 's retro gameplay has its undeniable charms that most people will find hard to resist.

Instead of staring at markers on a map, players must listen to directions and follow them while looking at a simple, unmarked map from time to time. This organic method of exploration makes every discovery rewarding as players make headway in their journey at their own pace, seeking to fulfill the prophecy and become the Nerevarine.

1 Caves Of Qud

A Roguelike Open-World Game With Numerous Opportunities To Explore

Players who want to check out a roguelike that emulates old-school gameplay and lets players explore a massive procedurally generated open world will love what Caves of Qud brings to the table. The title is punishing for beginners, who will likely die over and over again before figuring out what they must do to make meaningful progress in each run.

After these basics are cleared up, players will be introduced to the faction system and the various avenues of interest that they can check out. All of this combines to make Caves of Qud a rewarding open-world game where the simple visuals don't do justice to its incredibly complicated combat mechanics. As one would expect, players won't be drip-fed map markers in this title. Instead, how and where they want to explore is completely up to them.

item.title: Rumor: Microsoft May Be Preparing for Digital-Only Generation
item.description:
Summary

  • Xbox may end Series X sales in Brazil, hinting at a shift to digital focus globally.
  • Microsoft is emphasizing Xbox's digital ecosystem over dominating hardware sales.
  • Rumors suggest Xbox is moving towards an all-digital gaming future like Sega.

Rumors have surfaced that point to Xbox ceasing Series X sales in Brazil, compounding an existing scarcity for the system in some regions. Gamers have expressed concern that this is an indicator of a grim future for the Xbox brand altogether, but it's unclear whether these changes will remain specific to their region, or if they're a sign of the strategies Xbox will be implementing globally.

It's apparent that Xbox is focused on evolving, as execs like Phil Spencer have expressed recently. Seemingly no longer intent on dominating the hardware market altogether, there's been plenty of energy directed at driving attention toward Xbox's digital ecosystem using systems like the Series S in combination with their hugely popular Game Pass service. Rumors point to more movement in this direction for Xbox.

According to rumors from IconEra, Xbox is reducing its sales of the Series X console in Brazil, ultimately readying to cease shipments of the system in the region altogether. Others have corroborated the information, stating that Xbox is no longer restocking the series X in Brazil. Microsoft has reportedly pointed to Xbox Cloud Gaming and Game Pass as valid alternatives for players, insisting that these platforms will largely be the future of their services in this region.

The Series X May Stop Sales in Brazil

These rumors also seem to echo behavior from Xbox in Saudi Arabia and several European countries, with some feeling surprised at how hard it's become to find an Xbox Series X in their respective location. Although plenty of Xbox fans enjoy their Series S systems and a focus on digital gaming, many other fans are concerned that this could be another signal of Xbox bowing out of the Console race altogether. Although Phil Spencer and Xbox representatives have insisted on first-party support on the gaming end, dedicated Xbox players fear that the brand is shifting its tune about hardware.

Much of this information appears to indicate that Microsoft is attempting a clean break from physical gaming to push ahead into an all-digital future. Some have cited the "This is an Xbox" ad campaign as further evidence that this is the case, feeling as if the brand hasn't inspired much confidence in its existing hardware lately. For some, this seems like a natural step, believing that Xbox is mirroring how Sega behaved before its exit from the console market. Whether this instance is an isolated event or an indicator of the future of Xbox is yet to be seen.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: 12 Mods That Add New Armors
item.description:
Summary

  • Patch 7 in Baldur's Gate 3 introduced Toolkit Data for mod creation, expanding player customization options.
  • Armor mods like Avernus Warhound and Hexblade Armor enhance character customization and gameplay variety.
  • Mods like The Treasure Trove and GraphicFade Equipment provide themed equipment for specific classes, enriching gameplay.

Thanks to the arrival of patch 7 in Baldur's Gate 3 , players have gained access to the Toolkit Data, which enhances the freedom to create mods in the game. Through this tool, users have more liberty to modify the game, allowing them to create new options that further complement the gameplay of Baldur's Gate 3 .

In this way, new classes or even races are being added to the game, giving players more options to customize their characters throughout their journey. However, another very exciting addition in Baldur's Gate 3 is the armor mods, which add new possibilities for character attire, whether focused solely on appearance or for those seeking even more powerful options.

Updated February 21, 2025, by Eduardo Ariedo: After some time since Baldur's Gate 3 received official mod support, the community has been able to create various equipment and other amazing customizations for the game. 12 Avernus Warhound

An Armor Mod With Dieselpunk Design

Despite being a setting highly inspired by medieval fantasy, the universe of Faerûn, where the entire Baldur's Gate 3 saga takes place, has areas where the ambiance shifts slightly. One such area is Avernus, which players have the opportunity to explore briefly during the third act.

Drawing from these inspirations, this armor mod in Baldur's Gate 3 adds a new armor to the game inspired by the Dieselpunk aesthetic. Despite deviating somewhat from the game's more traditional designs, it remains a beautiful piece of equipment.   • Mod Link

Whether for Shadowheart, who has been respecced with Withers, or for a character designed to be a War Domain cleric, this armor mod in Baldur's Gate 3 adds one of the best cloak options for those who chose this domain in the game.
